list_definition.definition: a game for two played with thirty-two (usually black and white) pieces (chessmen) on a board (chessboard) with sixty-four (usually black and white) squares

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They were playing a game of chess

list_ex_of_english: In chess, for example, a computational theory of the problem will hardly help to specify the players' decision processes.
They constitute what chess is and how to play the game.
In this example, someone is behaving somewhat like the ostensibly blundering chess player.
Consider chess again: without the conventions that constitute this game, there is no game of chess nor, consequently, a concept of chess.
The rules of chess have a crucial role to play in constituting our concept of chess.
Should we conclude that playing chess is (or is nothing but) moving pieces of wood and that chess is therefore a "physical phenomenon"?
The development of various chess-playing software enabled the robot to play chess with people intelligently.
With the chess-playing program, the intelligent library and the relevant application program of image processing, the robot can make exact decisions and reach its goal.
